articles.headline: Apple Plans to Inhabit Living Room
articles.snippet: A device due out next year will wirelessly stream video and music from a Macintosh computer to a television.
articles.abstract: A device due out next year will wirelessly stream video and music from a Macintosh computer to a television.
articles.byline: By John Markoff and Laura M. Holson

articles.headline: Flush With Jobs, Wyoming Woos Rust Belt Labor
articles.snippet: Labor-starved Wyoming is vigorously courting workers from Michigan’s struggling auto industry.
articles.abstract: Labor-starved Wyoming is vigorously courting workers from Michigan’s struggling auto industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: GILLETTE, Wyo., Sept. 6  Houston Mellentine, 10, held up the rattlesnake tail he kept in a box. “Killed it right over there,” he said, pointing to the edge of his family’s dirt front yard.

articles.headline: Drug Maker Fires Chief of 5 Years
articles.snippet: The Bristol-Myers Squibb board bowed to a federal monitor’s pressure after a mishandled attempt to solve a patent dispute.
articles.abstract: The Bristol-Myers Squibb board bowed to a federal monitor’s pressure after a mishandled attempt to solve a patent dispute.
articles.lead_paragraph: The troubled five-year term of Peter R. Dolan as chief executive of the drug maker Bristol-Myers Squibb ended yesterday when the board dismissed him over the mishandling of a patent dispute involving the company’s blockbuster drug, Plavix.

articles.headline: French Presidential Hopeful Tours the U.S.
articles.snippet: Nicolas Sarkozy hopes his four-day U.S. trip will win him votes on the French right.
articles.abstract: Nicolas Sarkozy hopes his four-day U.S. trip will win him votes on the French right.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 — Nicolas Sarkozy is campaigning hard to be the next president of France on the jogging trails of Central Park and in the corridors of the White House.

articles.headline: The War Over Salt
articles.snippet: The nation’s largest doctors’ group wants the government and the food industry to reduce what it sees as a persistently high level of salt in many processed foods.
articles.abstract: The nation’s largest doctors’ group wants the government and the food industry to reduce what it sees as a persistently high level of salt in many processed foods.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANK HALL knows he probably should not eat Hungry-Man dinners. The frozen meals have as much as 2,230 milligrams of sodium per serving — far more than the government’s recommended daily allowance for older people — and Mr. Hall’s doctors have advised him to strictly limit salt consumption to help keep his blood pressure down.

articles.headline: Modern Ways Open India’s Doors to Diabetes
articles.snippet: In India, alongside the stick-thin poverty, the malaria and the AIDS, the number of diabetics now totals around 35 million, and counting.
articles.abstract: In India, alongside the stick-thin poverty, the malaria and the AIDS, the number of diabetics now totals around 35 million, and counting.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHENNAI, India — There are many ways to understand diabetes in this choking city of automakers and software companies, where the disease seems as commonplace as saris. One way is through the story of P. Ganam, 50, a proper woman reduced to fake gold.

articles.headline: The Lonelygirl That Really Wasn’t
articles.snippet: After months of intrigue, the identities of Web video star lonelygirl15 and her producers have been revealed.
articles.abstract: After months of intrigue, the identities of Web video star lonelygirl15 and her producers have been revealed.
articles.lead_paragraph: A nearly four-month-old Internet drama in which the cryptic video musings of a fresh-faced teenager became the obsession of millions of devotees — themselves divided over the very authenticity of the videos, or who was behind them or why — appears to be in its final act.
articles.byline: By Virginia Heffernan and Tom Zeller Jr

articles.headline: Spying Uproar Causes Shuffle in Boardroom
articles.snippet: Hewlett-Packard’s chairwoman will step aside, the C.E.O. will succeed her and the longest-serving director resigned.
articles.abstract: Hewlett-Packard’s chairwoman will step aside, the C.E.O. will succeed her and the longest-serving director resigned.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 12 — Hewlett-Packard shook up its board Tuesday in an artfully calibrated agreement that seemed to leave all the parties in its boardroom drama satisfied, if not happy. Its chairwoman will step aside in January, the chief executive will succeed her and the longest-serving director resigned.
articles.byline: By Damon Darlin and Matt Richtel

articles.headline: Gunmen in Syria Hit U.S. Embassy; 3 Attackers Die
articles.snippet: The attack sent shudders through a region where anger toward the U.S. has surged in recent weeks.
articles.abstract: The attack sent shudders through a region where anger toward the U.S. has surged in recent weeks.
articles.lead_paragraph: DAMASCUS, Syria, Wednesday, Sept. 13 — Four gunmen attacked the American Embassy here early Tuesday, storming the compound with grenades and automatic weapons before being repelled by Syrian security forces. Three of the gunmen were killed and a fourth was wounded, Syrian and American officials said.

articles.headline: Distractions and Bargains Bought in Bulk
articles.snippet: Thanks to eBay and Costco, among others, a sizable portion of the retail economy is built on bargains that aren't really bargains.
articles.abstract: Thanks to eBay and Costco, among others, a sizable portion of the retail economy is built on bargains that aren't really bargains.
articles.lead_paragraph: WE were in the vicinity of the two-gallon tubs of mayonnaise when my wife committed warehouse club heresy. “Sometimes I wonder how much of this stuff is actually a good deal,” she said.

articles.headline: The Lonelygirl That Really Wasn’t
articles.snippet: A nearly four-month-old Internet drama in which the cryptic video musings of a fresh-faced teenager became the obsession of millions of devotees -- themselves divided over the very authenticity of the videos, or who was behind them or why -- appea...
articles.abstract: A nearly four-month-old Internet drama in which the cryptic video musings of a fresh-faced teenager became the obsession of millions of devotees -- themselves divided over the very authenticity of the videos, or who was behind them or why -- appears to be in its final act.     The woman who plays Lonelygirl15 on the video-sharing site YouTube.com has been identified as Jessica Rose, a 20-ish resident of New Zealand and Los Angeles and a graduate of the New York Film Academy. And the whole project appears to be the early serialized version of what eventually will become a movie.
articles.lead_paragraph: A nearly four-month-old Internet drama in which the cryptic video musings of a fresh-faced teenager became the obsession of millions of devotees -- themselves divided over the very authenticity of the videos, or who was behind them or why -- appears to be in its final act.
articles.byline: By Virginia Heffernan and Tom Zeller Jr

articles.headline: Apple Plans to Inhabit Living Room
articles.snippet: Steven P. Jobs, Apple Computer's chief executive, concluded a much-anticipated company event on Tuesday with his usual tease, noting that he had ''one last thing'' to introduce.      Then, in an unusual departure from Apple's practice of announcin...
articles.abstract: Steven P. Jobs, Apple Computer's chief executive, concluded a much-anticipated company event on Tuesday with his usual tease, noting that he had ''one last thing'' to introduce.      Then, in an unusual departure from Apple's practice of announcing new products when they are ready to ship, he talked about a product due out early next year that will be the company's first step into the living room. The device, which Apple is calling iTV for now, will plug into a television and wirelessly pull in video and music from a Macintosh computer in the den or from the Internet. The box, which will cost $299, is about the size of a slim paperback novel.
articles.byline: By John Markoff and Laura M. Holson

articles.headline: Widening His Campaign Trail, French Hopeful Tours the U.S.
articles.snippet: Nicolas Sarkozy is campaigning hard to be the next president of France on the jogging trails of Central Park and in the corridors of the White House.     On a four-day trip to the United States, the 51-year-old minister of the interior, France's l...
articles.abstract: Nicolas Sarkozy is campaigning hard to be the next president of France on the jogging trails of Central Park and in the corridors of the White House.     On a four-day trip to the United States, the 51-year-old minister of the interior, France's leading presidential hopeful on the right, pinned the Legion of Honor on the police commissioner of New York, honored firefighters in Midtown Manhattan for their losses on 9/11 and signed hundreds of copies of his new best-selling book on France's future.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 - Nicolas Sarkozy is campaigning hard to be the next president of France on the jogging trails of Central Park and in the corridors of the White House.

articles.headline: Gunmen in Syria Hit U.S. Embassy; 3 Attackers Die
articles.snippet: Four gunmen attacked the American Embassy here early Tuesday, storming the compound with grenades and automatic weapons before being repelled by Syrian security forces. Three of the gunmen were killed and a fourth was wounded, Syrian and American ...
articles.abstract: Four gunmen attacked the American Embassy here early Tuesday, storming the compound with grenades and automatic weapons before being repelled by Syrian security forces. Three of the gunmen were killed and a fourth was wounded, Syrian and American officials said.     One Syrian security official was killed and about a dozen people were wounded, including three Syrian security officials and a Syrian guard employed by the embassy. No American personnel were injured and the attackers failed to detonate a vehicle packed with explosives.
articles.lead_paragraph: DAMASCUS, Syria, Wednesday, Sept. 13 - Four gunmen attacked the American Embassy here early Tuesday, storming the compound with grenades and automatic weapons before being repelled by Syrian security forces. Three of the gunmen were killed and a fourth was wounded, Syrian and American officials said.

articles.headline: Drug Maker Fires Chief of 5 Years
articles.snippet: The troubled five-year term of Peter R. Dolan as chief executive of the drug maker Bristol-Myers Squibb ended yesterday when the board dismissed him over the mishandling of a patent dispute involving the company's blockbuster drug, Plavix.     Mr....
articles.abstract: The troubled five-year term of Peter R. Dolan as chief executive of the drug maker Bristol-Myers Squibb ended yesterday when the board dismissed him over the mishandling of a patent dispute involving the company's blockbuster drug, Plavix.     Mr. Dolan, 50, was replaced with an interim chief, James M. Cornelius, a Bristol-Myers director. Mr. Cornelius had recently served as the interim chief executive of the medical device maker Guidant and was a crucial player in its agreement to be acquired earlier this year by Boston Scientific.
articles.lead_paragraph: The troubled five-year term of Peter R. Dolan as chief executive of the drug maker Bristol-Myers Squibb ended yesterday when the board dismissed him over the mishandling of a patent dispute involving the company's blockbuster drug, Plavix.

articles.headline: Flush With Jobs, Wyoming Woos Rust Belt Labor
articles.snippet: Houston Mellentine, 10, held up the rattlesnake tail he kept in a box. ''Killed it right over there,'' he said, pointing to the edge of his family's dirt front yard.     His mother, Melissa, sat in a folding chair as the sun set one recent evening...
articles.abstract: Houston Mellentine, 10, held up the rattlesnake tail he kept in a box. ''Killed it right over there,'' he said, pointing to the edge of his family's dirt front yard.     His mother, Melissa, sat in a folding chair as the sun set one recent evening, eyeing the snake's tail in her son's hand. ''They don't have rattlesnakes in Michigan,'' she said somewhat longingly, at least not in her old front yard.
articles.lead_paragraph: GILLETTE, Wyo., Sept. 6 - Houston Mellentine, 10, held up the rattlesnake tail he kept in a box. "Killed it right over there," he said, pointing to the edge of his family's dirt front yard.

articles.headline: Spying Uproar Causes Shuffle in Boardroom
articles.snippet: Hewlett-Packard shook up its board Tuesday in an artfully calibrated agreement that seemed to leave all the parties in its boardroom drama satisfied, if not happy. Its chairwoman will step aside in January, the chief executive will succeed her and...
articles.abstract: Hewlett-Packard shook up its board Tuesday in an artfully calibrated agreement that seemed to leave all the parties in its boardroom drama satisfied, if not happy. Its chairwoman will step aside in January, the chief executive will succeed her and the longest-serving director resigned.      The moves were part of an attempt to mend a board racked by disclosures that the company hired investigators who surreptitiously -- and possibly illegally -- obtained the private telephone records of directors and journalists.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 12 - Hewlett-Packard shook up its board Tuesday in an artfully calibrated agreement that seemed to leave all the parties in its boardroom drama satisfied, if not happy. Its chairwoman will step aside in January, the chief executive will succeed her and the longest-serving director resigned.
articles.byline: By Damon Darlin and Matt Richtel

articles.headline: Distractions and Bargains Bought in Bulk
articles.snippet: WE were in the vicinity of the two-gallon tubs of mayonnaise when my wife committed warehouse club heresy. ''Sometimes I wonder how much of this stuff is actually a good deal,'' she said.     With some items, neither of us had any doubt. Our local...
articles.abstract: WE were in the vicinity of the two-gallon tubs of mayonnaise when my wife committed warehouse club heresy. ''Sometimes I wonder how much of this stuff is actually a good deal,'' she said.     With some items, neither of us had any doubt. Our local Costco sells an enormous hunk of Vermont cheddar cheese for just a little more than the supermarket charges for a modest piece of the same brand. Canned tomatoes are also a great deal, and if you buy diapers at Costco for a few years, you'll save enough money to buy an iMac.
articles.lead_paragraph: WE were in the vicinity of the two-gallon tubs of mayonnaise when my wife committed warehouse club heresy. "Sometimes I wonder how much of this stuff is actually a good deal," she said.

articles.headline: The War Over Salt
articles.snippet: FRANK HALL knows he probably should not eat Hungry-Man dinners. The frozen meals have as much as 2,230 milligrams of sodium per serving -- far more than the government's recommended daily allowance for older people -- and Mr. Hall's doctors have a...
articles.abstract: FRANK HALL knows he probably should not eat Hungry-Man dinners. The frozen meals have as much as 2,230 milligrams of sodium per serving -- far more than the government's recommended daily allowance for older people -- and Mr. Hall's doctors have advised him to strictly limit salt consumption to help keep his blood pressure down.     But once a week, when grocery shopping with his granddaughter, Mr. Hall, who is 80 and has heart disease, tosses one or two of the big blue packages in his cart anyway.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANK HALL knows he probably should not eat Hungry-Man dinners. The frozen meals have as much as 2,230 milligrams of sodium per serving -- far more than the government's recommended daily allowance for older people -- and Mr. Hall's doctors have advised him to strictly limit salt consumption to help keep his blood pressure down.
